results.title: Explorers of the depths
results.brief_description: An account of the work of Scottish Fisheries Research to determine the causes of reduced fish catches in the North Sea. Sampling the sea-water and plankton at various depths, tagging fish, calculating the age of fish from their scale-ring, discovering the causes for the premature destruction of young fish - these are aspects of the research work which will prove of great importance to the fishermen of Scotland.

results.title: Explorations of Prince Henry
results.brief_description: Presents an overview of the life of Prince Henry of Portugal during the age of exploration. Portrays the annihilation of the Muslims, the expansion of the Christian faith and the discovery of a sea route to India.

results.title: Experimental design
results.creator_credit: Victor Lockwood, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: Rhys L.L. Davies demonstrates his innovative method of teaching fractions to primary school children. He discusses the methodology he used to test his method against traditional text books and Quizinnaire. Shows Rhys using the three methods with his students in class.

results.title: Experimental
results.creator_credit: Robin Lehman and R A Films
results.brief_description: A quirky history of experimental flight - hang-gliding and helicopters intercut with historical footage, student pranks and a Concorde with a mothergoose smile. Prize winner at 1975 Melbourne Film Festival.

results.title: Experiment in teaching
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Crabb, James Carr, Department of Education and Science (UK) and World Wide
results.brief_description: A description of new methods of teaching applied science in schools, with particular reference to engineering and technology. The film visits a number of schools including the Technical Activities Centre at Sevenoaks School and Cray Valley Technical High School where practical interest in such projects as making a steam engine, and a go-kart, encourage theoretical study. The common objective of these courses is to develop the pupils’ creative qualities of imaginative thought.

results.title: Experience of cubism
results.brief_description: An attempt to interpret the underlying principles and methods of cubism. The film compares examples of experimental art with objects as we actually see them and shows how the artist continues to draw on nature for the source of their material, but recomposes it for their own specific ends.

results.title: Expansion of metals
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Physics in action”.
Covers the expansion of a wire due to increase in heat from electric current: determination of the coefficient of expansion of brass; application of expansion in rails; building constructions and bridges; shrink fitting and expansion fitting of metal couplings. Suitable for upper secondary level.
